content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="fgdc_classic.xsl"?> <metadata xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/fgdc-std-001-1998.xsd">  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Donald R Pool</origin>     <origin>Stanley Leake</origin>     <origin>Jesse Dickinson</origin>     <pubdate>2014</pubdate>     <title>Digital geospatial data of the top of the Dakota sandstone and older rocks in the Upper Colorado River Basin</title>     <geoform>Raster Digital Data Set</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>Reston, Virginia</pubplace>      <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>     </pubinfo>     <onlink>http://water.usgs.gov/lookup/getspatial?ucrb_Dakota_ss_top</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>These raster data of the top surface of the Dakota sandstone of the Upper Colorado River Basin (UCRB) were created for the purpose of developing a generalized predevelopment groundwater flow model of the Mesozoic and Paleozoic aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin and use that model along with a few recharge estimates to estimate water budgets for the aquifers including associated groundwater contributions to the Colorado River surface water system. The modeling exercise also explored considerations for development of a more detailed groundwater flow model that would include all of the major aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin.</abstract>    <purpose>These data were derived from various other sources (maps) in order to present a cohesive top of the Dakota sandstone in the Upper Colorado River Basin for use in the development of the UCRB Groundwater Flow Model.</purpose>    <supplinf>Data are as current as the publications that provided the information and maps. The top of the Dakota sandstone and older rocks was created from contour maps of the depth to the top of the Dakota sandstone and polygon extents in the UCRB from PP1411-C Figure 23. The contours of the altitude of the top of the Dakota sandstone in the San Juan Basin area are from HA 720-I Plate 1, Figure 6.</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>2013</caldate>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>See Supplemental Info</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>None planned</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc>-113.127816399</westbc>     <eastbc>-105.435353047</eastbc>     <northbc>43.531871528</northbc>     <southbc>34.221712402</southbc>    </bounding>   </spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>     <themekey>Dakota sandstone</themekey>    </theme>    <place>     <placekt>None</placekt>     <placekey>Colorado</placekey>     <placekey>Arizona</placekey>     <placekey>Utah</placekey>     <placekey>New Mexico</placekey>     <placekey>Upper Colorado River Basin</placekey>    </place>   </keywords>   <accconst>None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.</accconst>   <useconst>None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.</useconst>   <ptcontac>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey, Southwest Region</cntorg>      <cntper>Donald R Pool</cntper>     </cntorgp>     <cntpos>Hydrologist</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype>      <address>520 North Park Avenue</address>      <city>Tucson</city>      <state>AZ</state>      <postal>85721</postal>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>520-670-6671 x258</cntvoice>     <cntfax>520-670-5592</cntfax>     <cntemail>drpool@usgs.gov</cntemail>    </cntinfo>   </ptcontac>   <browse>    <browsen>http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/browse/UCRB_Dakota_ss_top.jpg</browsen>    <browsed>Illustration of the dataset.</browsed>    <browset>JPG</browset>   </browse>   <native>Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.2 (Build 3497) Service Pack [N/A] (Build [N/A])</native>  </idinfo>  <dataqual>   <attracc>    <attraccr>Initial digitizing of maps and figures included a visual check to be sure all linework was present, and all lines were labelled correctly.</attraccr>   </attracc>   <logic>No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.</logic>   <complete>Data set is considered complete for the information presented. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.</complete>   <posacc>    <horizpa>     <horizpar>A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.</horizpar>    </horizpa>    <vertacc>     <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>    </vertacc>   </posacc>   <lineage>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>Freethey, G.W. and Cordy, G.E.</origin>       <pubdate>1991</pubdate>       <title>Geohydrology of Mesozoic rocks in the upper Colorado River basin in Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico, Utah, and Wyoming, excluding the San Juan Basin</title>   <caldate>1991</caldate>       </sngdate>      </timeinfo>      <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>     </srctime>     <srccitea>PP 1411-C, Figure 23</srccitea>     <srccontr>Altitude contours of the depth to the top of the Dakota sandstone, polygon extents of Dakota sandstone</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>Craigg, S.D., Dam, W.L., Kernodle, J.M., Levings, G.W.</origin>       <pubdate>1989</pubdate>       <title>Hydrogeology of the Dakota Sandstone in the San Juan structural basin, New Mexico, Colorado, Arizona, and Utah</title>       <geoform>Paper Map</geoform>       <pubinfo>        <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>        <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>       </pubinfo>       <onlink>http://pubs.er.usgs.gov/publication/ha720I</onlink>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>     <typesrc>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</typesrc>     <srctime>      <timeinfo>       <sngdate>        <caldate>1989</caldate>       </sngdate>      </timeinfo>      <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>     </srctime>     <srccitea>HA 720-I, Plate 1, Figure 6</srccitea>     <srccontr>Contours of the top of the Dakota sandstone in the San Juan Basin area</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Development of the data set by the agency/individuals identified in the 'Originator' element in the Identification Info section of the record.</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Digitized  from PP1411-C Fig 23.:  1. Contours of depth to top of Dakota sandstone 2. Polygon extents of Dakota sandstone 3. Polygons where Dakota sandstone is missing Digitized from HA 720-I Plate 1, Figure 6.: 1. Contours of altitude of the top of the Dakota sandstone in the San Juan Basin area</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>A contour map for the entire study area of depth to top of the Dakota sandstone was created from the contours for the UCRB and calculated depth to top in the San Juan basin. Depth to top in the San Juan basin was calculated by first gridding (1km) the contours of the top of Dakota surface using the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtopo to grid\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd tool and then subtracting that from the 1km land surface grid. This depth to top of Dakota grid was then contoured. The contours were merged with the UCRB depth to top contours and zero contours were added from outcrops of Dakota sandstone and older rocks to produce the shape file:  depth_to_Dakota_incl_San_Juan_and_zero_contours</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>A depth to Dakota sandstone surface was created for the entire study area using the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtopo to grid\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd tool: D2T_Dakota_lsa.tif</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>The top of Dakota was calculated as land surface minus depth to Dakota to produce the raster top_dakota_2 (this dataset)</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Created ASCII file of raster using Esri "Raster to ASCII" tool</procdesc>     <procdate>2014</procdate>    </procstep>   </lineage>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>   <direct>Raster</direct>   <rastinfo>    <rasttype>Grid Cell</rasttype>    <rowcount>1010</rowcount>    <colcount>620</colcount>    <vrtcount>1</vrtcount>   </rastinfo>  </spdoinfo>  <spref>   <horizsys>    <planar>     <gridsys>      <gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn>      <utm>       <utmzone>13</utmzone>       <transmer>        <sfctrmer>0.9996</sfctrmer>        <longcm>-105.0</longcm>        <latprjo>0.0</latprjo>        <feast>500000.0</feast>        <fnorth>0.0</fnorth>       </transmer>      </utm>     </gridsys>     <planci>      <plance>row and column</plance>      <coordrep>       <absres>1000.0</absres>       <ordres>1000.0</ordres>      </coordrep>      <plandu>Meter</plandu>     </planci>    </planar>    <geodetic>     <horizdn>D_North_American_1983</horizdn>     <ellips>GRS_1980</ellips>     <semiaxis>6378137.0</semiaxis>     <denflat>298.257222101</denflat>    </geodetic>   </horizsys>  </spref>  <eainfo>   <detailed>    <enttyp>     <enttypl>Attribute Table</enttypl>     <enttypd>Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.</enttypd>     <enttypds>Producer defined</enttypds>    </enttyp>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Value</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Altitude of Dakota sandstone</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Producer defined</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <rdom>       <rdommin>-9654.681640625</rdommin>       <rdommax>14007.994140625</rdommax>       <attrunit>feet</attrunit>      </rdom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>   </detailed>   <overview>    <eaover>A contour map for the entire study area of depth to top of the Dakota sandstone was created from the contours for the UCRB and calculated depth to top in the San Juan basin. Depth to top in the San Juan basin was calculated by first gridding (1km) the contours of the top of Dakota surface using the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtopo to grid\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd tool and then subtracting that from the 1km land surface grid.  This depth to top of Dakota grid was then contoured.  The contours were then merged with the UCRB depth to top contours and zero contours were added from outcrops of Dakota ss and older rocks to produce the  contour shape file. A depth to Dakota sandstone surface was then created for the entire study area using the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtopo to grid\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd tool. The top of Dakota was calculated as land surface minus depth to Dakota to produce this dataset.</eaover>    <eadetcit>The top of the Dakota sandstone and older rocks was created from contour maps of the depth to the top of Dakota sandstone in the UCRB from PP1411C Fig 23. and polygon extents and contours of the altitude of the top of Dakota sandstone in the San Juan Basin area from  HA720I plate 1, Fig 6.</eadetcit>   </overview>  </eainfo>  <distinfo>   <distrib>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey</cntorg>      <cntper>Donald R Pool</cntper>     </cntorgp>
